text.div:
EpisodeOfCare Logical Model

An association between a patient and an organization / healthcare provider(s) during which time encounters may occur. The managing organization assumes a level of responsibility for the patient during this time.

name: EpisodeOfCare
title: shr-core-EpisodeOfCare
description: An association between a patient and an organization / healthcare provider(s) during which time encounters may occur. The managing organization assumes a level of responsibility for the patient during this time.

element.definition: An association between a patient and an organization / healthcare provider(s) during which time encounters may occur. The managing organization assumes a level of responsibility for the patient during this time.

element.short: Elements that belong to all information items.
element.definition: Elements that belong to all information items.

element.short: A human language, spoken or written.
element.definition: A human language, spoken or written.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A set of rules under which this content was created

element.short: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.
element.definition: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.

element.short: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.
element.definition: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.

element.short: List of past encounter statuses
element.definition: List of past encounter statuses

element.short: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.
element.definition: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.

element.short: A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year.
element.definition:
A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year.
If the start date/time is missing, the start of the period is not known. If the end date/time is missing, it means that the period is ongoing.

element.short: Business identifier or external id for this resource.
element.definition: Business identifier or external id for this resource.

element.short: A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year.
element.definition:
A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year.
If the start date/time is missing, the start of the period is not known. If the end date/time is missing, it means that the period is ongoing.

element.short: A diagnosis, which is a disease or injury determined to be present through evaluation of patient history, examination, and/or review of laboratory data. This element is not a stand-alone representation of the condition that was diagnosed, but is meant to be used as an sub-structure in a resource, such as Encounter.
element.definition: A diagnosis, which is a disease or injury determined to be present through evaluation of patient history, examination, and/or review of laboratory data. This element is not a stand-alone representation of the condition that was diagnosed, but is meant to be used as an sub-structure in a resource, such as Encounter.

element.short: The subject of a clinical statement, often called the Patient or the Subject. The SubjectOfRecord typically identifies the clinical record in which this statement is contained. If the statement should be in John Doe's patient record, then John Doe is the subject of record. When there is no patient, the SubjectOfRecord can also be a location, group, or other entity that statement pertains to. For example, observations concerning a hospital ward would have a Location as the SubjectOfRecord.
element.definition:
The subject of a clinical statement, often called the Patient or the Subject. The SubjectOfRecord typically identifies the clinical record in which this statement is contained. If the statement should be in John Doe's patient record, then John Doe is the subject of record. When there is no patient, the SubjectOfRecord can also be a location, group, or other entity that statement pertains to. For example, observations concerning a hospital ward would have a Location as the SubjectOfRecord.

Note that the word 'Subject' is used here in the sense of a person or entity subjected to observations or actions, not subject as in a conceptual topic, like heart disease.

element.short: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.
element.definition: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.

element.short: A formally or informally recognized grouping of people or organizations formed for the purpose of achieving some form of collective action. Includes companies, institutions, corporations, departments, community groups, healthcare practice groups, payer/insurer, etc.
element.definition:
A formally or informally recognized grouping of people or organizations formed for the purpose of achieving some form of collective action. Includes companies, institutions, corporations, departments, community groups, healthcare practice groups, payer/insurer, etc.

Organization type is restricted to 0..1 in FHIR DSTU2, similarly restricted here. Other required attributes come from STU 3 mapping to us-core-organization.

element.short: Indicates any plans, proposals or orders that this request is intended to satisfy - in whole or in part.
element.definition: Indicates any plans, proposals or orders that this request is intended to satisfy - in whole or in part.

element.short: Care manager/care co-ordinator for the patient
element.definition: Care manager/care co-ordinator for the patient
